captions.text:
How to Convince Your Mother to Let You Get
a Dog. If you've dreamed of canine companionship

but a stubborn parent is standing in your
way, use this guide to champion all the benefits

of a family dog. You will need Responsibility
and perseverance. Step 1. Research the right

type of dog for your family and lifestyle
as well as the cost of the license, shots,

and other fees. Be as knowledgeable as possible.
Show off several possible options to get your

mother interested and emotionally involved
in picking a cute furry friend. Step 2. Display

enough responsibility to take care of a dog
by keeping up with your chores, cleaning your

room, and maintaining good grades in school.
Step 3. Talk about the benefits of getting

a dog such as security at home, friendship,
and more time outside playing instead of lounging

in front of the TV. Step 4. Offer incentives
such as chipping in for the cost, or ask for

a dog as a gift for a birthday or for a major
personal accomplishment like straight A's.

A part-time job will help with the costs of
the dog and speak volumes on your commitment

level. Step 5. Think of possible reasons your
mother doesn't want a dog and come up with

counter arguments to keep her from saying
no right away. Step 6. Beg as a last resort.

If nothing's working, drop the topic, but
bring it up periodically until a compromise

is reached and a new puppy or dog is adopted.
Did you know The bloodhound, known for its

keen sense of smell, is the only dog breed
to have the evidence it collects allowed in

title: How to Convince Your Mother to Let You Get a Dog

Help plz:
ok, erm so. I've always wanted a dog, my gran is a dog lover, and my dad 
loves all dogs except chihuahuas. The worst part tho, is that my mom 
doesn't like dogs. Or maybe it's the fact that my little sis is allergic to 
some dogs... Anyway, We went to the adoption center [mom was saying "we are 
here for looking. I never wanted to be here and I'm doing this for u. No 
buying dogs!]and saw a cute German Shepard/chihuahua and fell in love. When 
we asked my mom, however, she said no. We came back the next week, but 
found out that the dog had already been adopted! Of course, we know about 
hypo allergenic dogs, but those shed too much. We can't get a big dog. We 
want a chihuahua. My dad doesn't like chihuahuas... What can I do!?? 😓😓😓﻿

comments.text:
I know this sounds stupid, but my dad always said to me, a dog will find 
you so don't go looking to buy a dog as soon as you want one!  I know at 
your age you must want one bad! however you should wait because... often 
(depends what breed of dog you get) dogs need space, so living in a small 
house may not be the best, also dogs need a LOT of attention especially in 
the first few months of adopting/buying one so if you are at school  and 
both parents work, the dog may become destructive! May I suggest that you 
offer to dog-sit a friends dog for a weekend and see how that goes, also do 
something nice to help the dogs/animals in the pet shelters around you 
(this will show your parents that you are not just in some phase of liking 
dogs!) An when you get a dog (eventually) DO NOT get it from a pet shop, 
get it from a breeder or from even from a dog shelter! REMEMBER you will 
know when its the right time to get a dog! GOOD LUCK, but remember it is 
actually cruel to get a dog just because you want one if you don't have the 
right living standards of responsibilities, so as hard as it will be ask 
your self is it really the right time for a dog... nothing breaks my heart 
more than cruelty to animals! +Alex Alvarez and +Purple Hawaii Gurlz also 
maybe to +toaha ali 

Sincerely ME!
Sources: Many years of experience with dogs, pets, working at dog shelters1
